definition: burning beanstalks to cook the beans (idiom); to cause internecine strife
to cook/to boil
bean/pea/CL:棵[ke1],粒[li4]/sacrificial vessel
to burn/to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes)/to start (debate)/to raise (hopes)
stalks of pulse
internecine strife (idiom); fighting among oneself
lit. an old ox licking its calf (idiom)/fig. (of parents) to dote on one's children
wielding the halberd within the household (idiom); internecine strife
lit. the birds are over, the bow is put away (idiom); fig. to get rid of sb once he has served his purpose
to judge people based on their success or failure (idiom)
lit. sandpiper and clam war together (and the fisherman catches both) (idiom); fig. neighbors who can't agree lose out to a third party
to be completely honest and sincere (idiom)
lit. the solicitude of the crow (who provides for his old parent)(idiom)/fig. filial piety
to kill a pig as a lesson to the children (idiom); parents must teach by example
lit. to boil the hound once it caught the rabbit (idiom)/fig. to get rid of sb once he has served his purpose
lit. a chicken and a bottle of wine (idiom); fig. ready to make an offering to the deceased, or to entertain guests
to sit and await success or failure (idiom); to wait to see the outcome of a fight before taking sides/to sit on the fence
Mr Zhu Yun breaks the railing (idiom); to challenge and admonish boldly
close kindred slaughter one another (idiom); internecine strife
to beg while playing the xiao 箫 (mouth organ)/cf Wu Zixu 伍子胥, destitute refugee from Chu 楚, busked in Wu town c. 520 BC, then became a powerful politician
lit. a short-cut to crush Guo (idiom); fig. to connive with sb to damage a third party, then turn on the partner
